moduleTitle: Writing Academically: Arts and Social Sciences
prerequisite: Students who are required to read ES1000 Basic English and/or ES1103 English for Academic Purposes must pass those modules before they are allowed to read this module.
moduleDescription: This module develops and applies the core strategies that underlie successful academic writing. These include writing with clarity and precision, analysing how authors argue, organizing and expressing ideas to guide readers through a line of reasoning, citing and documenting sources, revising the content, wording, and organization of a paper, as well as surface features such as spelling and punctuation. Students gain an appreciation of the basics of academic writing through three units, which correspond to the three stages of writing – introduction, body, and conclusion.
